0.Pros: Discount meals, nice cowokers, good start for HighSchool Graduate or first part time job.
0.Cons: Dealing with different people from different background.

1.Pros: They pay more than minimum wage, and they really work with your schedule if you're in school.
1.Cons: You work on your feet for an extended period of time before they allow you to take a break. Only one 30 minute break.

2.Pros: Did work with my school schedule
2.Cons: Managers above me didn't run the store well

3.Pros: Hours were flexible, the work environment was relaxed.
3.Cons: Sometimes they seemed to work you pretty hard for a minimum wage job. As a first job or for someone living with parents/going to school and not having to pay all their expenses, the pay was realistic. I did not see how someone living on their own could make much money though.

4.Pros: Flexible scheduling. Easy job. Clear standards. Easy application and hiring process. Training is short and engaging. Management works with entry level employees.
4.Cons: At the time I was employed by McDonalds there was too much supervisor/subordinate relationships which led to unfair scheduling and positioning.

5.Pros: Good people and a fast placed environment
5.Cons: It's McDonald's and there isn't room for promotions

6.Pros: great food and sodas that i love

7.Pros: Time Flexibility works very well for part time status
7.Cons: Having to stay longer than scheduled sometimes

8.Pros: Creates a solid foundation on time-management and communication skills as well as teamwork and team leading skills.
8.Cons: It does not provide much growth within it's employees.

9.Pros: Flexible hours, fun job, great kids
